授業目的: 本講義は、国際関係学を学んだことのある受講生を対象に、主要な理論を学び、国際関係学において中心的な議論となる諸テーマへを理解し、国際政治における様々な事象に対する独自の視点を養成する事を目的とする。
到達目標:
以下の諸点を授業の目標として設定しています。
・国際政治学の主な理論を理解する。
・国際政治学の、学問上の主要な議論や問いを学び、独自の分析を行う力をつける。
授業方法: This　class will be conducted in a regular classroom setting from the first class.  There may be some class cancellations and make-up classes subsequently. In case of cancellation, make-up classes will be held either on days designated by the school or mutually convenient days/periods. (Days/time periods would be decided upon consultations between the lecturer and students).

トピック.授業外学習2: This is not an introductory course. Students will be expected to have some exposure to the study of International Relations prior to taking this course.  For example, students who have taken another course I teach, "Introduction to International Relations" (offered in fall semester) or other equivalent courses on international relations are eligible to take this course.  Having said that, any students who are enthusiastic about studying International Relations and in English are welcome to attend.  Reading materials will be distributed by email and/or LUNA.

Each course is positioned within the curriculum in accordance with the diploma policy and curriculum policy established by each undergraduate/graduate school. By proceeding with the study of this course with an awareness of the DP and CP, the following abilities expected by each undergraduate/graduate school will be developed.
Global Studies:
1. Understanding and analytical skills regarding international issues: the ability to understand and analyze various regions of the world from different perspectives in the humanities and social sciences.
2. Problem-solving skills: the ability to proactively identify problems and solve them based on appropriate methods.
3. Intercultural understanding and multicultural coexistence: the ability to be sensitive to different cultures and to coexist with diverse cultures.

name: 【420】Theories and Debates in the Studies of Int'l Relations／Theories and Debates in the Studies of Int'l Relations [EN]
成績評価備考:
備考　Note
The course has the following three sets of requirements:

1. Regular class attendance and active participation in class based on the required readings.
2. One or more in-class oral report. (The number of the oral report will depend on the
number of students who register for this course. Each student will sign up for one or more required weekly readings, prepare to orally report them in class. The oral report must include both a summary of
the assigned readings and the student's own reactions to them that are not mere impressions but are based on a thoughtful analysis.
3. Performance in two debate sessions
4．Final examination

Course grades will be calculated in the following manner:

Class attendance and participation 20%
One or more in-class oral reports 20%
Debate (15% each) 30%
Final examination 30%

Feedback to the final examination will be posted on LUNA after grading is completed.
